title: shap v0.40 : shap.plots.bar(shape_values) + RandomForestClassfier = Fail
body:
I follow the first example of https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example_notebooks/api_examples/plots/bar.html
If XGBClassifier is used the result is correct but it fails when RandomForestClassifier are called.

Current versions of Google Colab:
- scikit-learn: 0.22.2.post1
- shap: 0.40

```python
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
import shap

X,y = shap.datasets.adult()
# model = XGBClassifier().fit(X, y)
model = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=123).fit(X, y)

# compute SHAP values
explainer = shap.Explainer(model,X)
shap_values = explainer(X)

shap.plots.bar(shap_values)
```
Result:

```python
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-11-226c8b35369d> in <module>()
----> 1 shap.plots.bar(shap_values)

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/shap/plots/_bar.py in bar(shap_values, max_display, order, clustering, clustering_cutoff, merge_cohorts, show_data, show)
    157     for pos,inds in enumerate(orig_inds):
    158         if len(inds) == 1:
--> 159             feature_names_new.append(feature_names[inds[0]])
    160         else:
    161             full_print = " + ".join([feature_names[i] for i in inds])

IndexError: list index out of range
```
